title: Katie Price could be made bankrupt within just six weeks
text:
A court heard Ms Price, pictured two nights ago, could be declared bankrupt in six weeks

Former glamour model Katie Price could be made bankrupt within six weeks after allegedly failing to keep up with her monthly payments.

The reality TV star is being pursued by creditors and the taxman after revealing she has burned through her entire £45million fortune.

She submitted a payment plan - known as an Individual Voluntary Agreement - over her estimated £250,000 debts to the High Court last December.

Had she not done so the court could have declared her bankrupt and appointed a trustee to sell off her assets, including her £2million home in Dial Post, West Sussex.

Price was not at the hearing at the Insolvency and Companies Court at the High Court today.

But Judge Sally Barber noted that Price had allegedly failed to keep up with her monthly repayments with her IVA.

She added: 'Technically it's not an adjournment so I'm extending time.

'Service will be effective on the expiry of seven days of completion of such sending of the email and such posting.

'Once you've done both, service will be effective on the expiry of seven days.

'I also extend the time for hearing the bankruptcy petition - I think six weeks.'

She recently let cameras film her oft-criticsed home for a documentary - but might be forced to sell the West Sussex property

The property in West Sussex was bought with part of her estimated £45m fortune

The hearing was adjourned until November 27 to hear whether she will be made bankrupt.

A draft petition notice will be served to her in the post.

Price bought the sprawling, nine-bed house in 2014, and includes the 1930s house - which comes with 12.25 acres, a swimming pool, tennis courts, stables and paddocks.

The thrice-married mother-of five split from most recent husband Kieran Hayler last year.

Price was the winner of the fifteenth series of Celebrity Big Brother and was runner-up in the search for the UK's entry for the Eurovision Song Contest in 2005.
description: Former glamour model Katie Price, from West Sussex, could be made bankrupt within six weeks. In December she agreed a payment plan with the courts over estimated debts of around £250,000.
